tit.cmt: タイトルなので補足をのぞきました。

sen.j: 牛車（ぎっしゃ）は、ウシや水牛に牽引させる乗り物のひとつ。
sen.e: A gissha (ox-drawn carriage) is a kind of vehicles drawn by oxen or water buffalos.
A gissha (ox-drawn carriage) is a kind of vehicle drawn by oxen or water buffalo.
A gissha (ox-drawn carriage) is a kind of vehicle drawn by oxen or water buffalo.

sen.j: 専ら荷物を運搬するものと乗客を運搬するものがある。
sen.e: Some are used only to carry loads, others only for passengers.
Some are used only to carry a load, others only for passengers.
Some are used only to carry a load, others only for passengers.

sen.j: なお、貴人が乗る乗用のものを（ぎっしゃ）、荷物を運搬するものを（ぎゅうしゃ）と、呼び分けるとしている辞書もある。
sen.e: There are some dictionaries that call the ones for noble passengers "gissha" and the ones for loads "gyusha".
There are some dictionaries that call the ones for noble passengers "gissha" and the ones for carrying a load "gyusha".
There are some dictionaries that call the ones for noble passengers 'gissha' and the ones for carrying a load 'gyusha.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置などを変えました。

sen.j: （平凡社大百科事典）
sen.e: Heibonsha daihyakkajiten (Encyclopaedia published by Heibonsha)
Heibonsha daihyakkajiten (Encyclopaedia published by Heibonsha)
(Heibonsha Daihyakkajiten (Encyclopedia published by Heibonsha))

sen.j: 平安時代には貴族の一般的な乗り物であった。
sen.e: In Heian period, it was a popular vehicle for the aristocracy.
During the Heian period, it was a popular vehicle for the aristocracy.
During the Heian period, it was a popular vehicle for the aristocracy.

sen.j: 現代日本では京都などで観光用や祭礼用として利用されることもある。
sen.e: In modern Japan, it is sometimes used for tourists or for festivals in Kyoto and other cities.
In modern Japan, it is sometimes used for tourists or for festivals in Kyoto and other cities.
In modern Japan, it is sometimes used for tourists or for festivals in Kyoto and other cities.

sen.j: 日本では観光用などを除いてあまり見かけられなくなったが、アジアをはじめとする発展途上国ではごく普通に見られる。
sen.e: Although it is no longer seen in Japan apart from sightseeing, in some developing countries in Asia and elsewhere it is still a very common sight.
Although it is no longer seen in Japan apart from sightseeing, in some developing countries in Asia and elsewhere it is still a very common sight.
Although it is no longer seen in Japan apart from sightseeing, in some developing countries in Asia and elsewhere it is still a very common sight.

sen.j: 唐庇車（からひさしのくるま）：屋根が唐破風造のような形状の最高級の牛車。
sen.e: Karahisashi no kuruma : the highest grade ox-drawn carriage with a roof shaped like a karahafu (cusped gable).
Karahisashi no kuruma: the highest grade of ox-drawn carriage with a roof shaped like a karahafu (cusped gable).
Karahisashi no kuruma: the highest grade of gissha with a roof shaped like a karahafu (cusped gable) zukuri style.

sen.j: 上皇もしくは摂政・関白が晴れの舞台で使う。
sen.e: Retired emperors, regents and chancellors used it on formal occasions.
Retired emperors, regents and chancellors used it on formal occasions.
Retired emperors, regents and chancellors used it on formal occasions.

sen.j: 大型で「桟（はしたて）」という梯子で乗り降りした。
sen.e: Due to its large size, people used a hashitate (ladder) when getting in and out.
Due to its large size, people used a hashitate (ladder) when getting in and out of the carriage.
Due to its large size, people used 'hashitate' (ladder) when getting in and out of the carriage.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: 屋根や庇などは檳榔で作り「蘇芳簾」という赤い簾をかける。
sen.e: The roof and eaves are made from binro leaves (Chinese fan palm (Livistona chinensis)), and a red curtain called a "suo sudare"(red-colored bamboo screen) is hung.
The roof and eaves are made from binro leaves (Chinese fan palm - Livistona chinensis), and a red curtain called a "suo sudare"(red-colored bamboo screen) is hung.
The roof and eaves are made from binro (Chinese fan palm (Livistona chinensis)) leaves, and a red curtain called a 'suo sudare' (red-colored bamboo screen) is hung.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 横の画像はこの車。
sen.e: The picture to the side is this vehicle.
This vehicle is shown in the side picture.
This vehicle is shown in the side picture.

sen.j: 雨眉車（あままゆのくるま）：摂政・関白が直衣姿の折に使う上の唐車の簡略版。
sen.e: Amamayu no kuruma: a simplified version of the karahisashi no kuruma above, used by regents and chancellors when they wore noshi (everyday clothes for nobles).
sen.cmt: 「唐車」では該当なし、文中に「上記の」とあるので「唐庇車」として訳しました。
sen.e: Amamayu no kuruma: a simplified version of the karahisashi no kuruma above, used by regents and chancellors when they wore noshi (everyday clothes for nobles).
Amamayu no kuruma: A simplified version of the karahisashi no kuruma above, used by regents and chancellors when they wore noshi (everyday clothes for nobles).

sen.j: 簾は青く下簾の帳も青裾濃。
sen.e: The bamboo blinds were blue, and the shita sudare (silk inner blinds that hung down inside the oxcart) were dyed in "ao-susogo" (lighter blue at the top, ranging to darker blue at the bottom).
The bamboo blinds were blue, and the shita sudare (silk inner blinds that hung down inside the oxcart) were dyed in "ao-susogo" (lighter blue at the top, ranging to darker blue at the bottom).
The bamboo blinds were blue, and the shita sudare (silk inner blinds that hung down inside the oxcart) were dyed in ao-susogo (lighter blue at the top, ranging to darker blue at the bottom).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 檳榔毛車（びろうげのくるま）：檳榔を細かく裂いて屋根を葺いた車。
sen.e: Birouge no kuruma: a carriage with its roof thatched with torn binro leaves.
Birouge no kuruma: a carriage with its roof thatched with torn binro leaves.
Biroge no kuruma: A carriage with its roof thatched with torn binro leaves.

sen.j: 参議までの上級貴族・賀茂祭の使いや入内する女房が使った。
sen.e: It was used by upper class nobles of at least the rank of Sangi (Consultants), the messengers at the Kamo festival, and nyobo (court ladies) when they entered court service.
It was used by upper class nobles with at least the rank of Sangi (Consultants), messengers at the Kamo festival, and nyobo (court ladies) when they entered court service.
It was used by upper class nobles with at least the rank of Sangi (Consultants), messengers at the Kamo Festival, and nyobo (court ladies) when they entered court service.

sen.j: 蘇芳簾で下簾は赤裾濃。
sen.e: With suo sudare (red-colored bamboo screen) and shita sudare (silk inner blinds that hung down inside the oxcart) dyed in "aka-susogo" (lighter red at the top, ranging to darker red at the bottom).
With suo sudare (red-colored bamboo screen) and shita sudare (silk inner blinds that hung down inside the oxcart) dyed in "aka-susogo" (lighter red at the top, ranging to darker red at the bottom).
With suo sudare and shita sudare dyed in aka-susogo (lighter red at the top, ranging to darker red at the bottom).
sen.cmt: 前出補足をのぞきました。

sen.j: 糸毛車（いとげのくるま）：詳細不明。
sen.e: Itoge no kuruma: details are unknown.
Itoge no kuruma: details are unknown.
Itoge no kuruma: Details are unknown.

sen.j: 皇后や皇太子は「青糸毛」、更衣 (女官)・典侍・内侍司などの上臈・小上臈・中臈の女房たちは「紫糸毛」に乗ったという。
sen.e: It is said that empresses and crown princes used "ao-itoge" (carts with blue/green threads), and that "murasaki-itoge" (carts with purple threads) were used for ladies-in-waiting, assistant handmaids, ladies of the handmaid's office, etc. - ladies of high, lower-high, or middle rank.
sen.cmt: 更衣、典侍＝役職名、内侍司＝役所の名前そのものを指す場合とそこにつとめている人を指す場合の両方があり、この場合がどちらか文脈上不明ですが、ここでは後者と解釈しました。また、参考資料によると、青は実際には緑のようです。（http://books.google.com/books?id=oWyaAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA86&dq=ao+itoge&lr=#v=onepage&q=ao%20itoge&f=false）
sen.e: It is said that empresses and crown princes used "ao-itoge" (carts with blue/green threads), and that "murasaki-itoge" (carts with purple threads) were used for ladies-in-waiting, assistant handmaids, ladies of the handmaid's office, etc. - ladies of high, lower-high, or middle rank.

It is said that empresses and crown princes used 'ao-itoge' (carts with blue or green threads), and joro (high rank woman servant in the Imperial Court), kojoro (certain daughters or granddaughters of daijin (the Ministers of State), nagon (the Counselors), and sangi (the Consultants) and other kugyo (senior nobles)), and churo (the middle rank woman servant in the Imperial Court) of nyobo, such as ladies-in-waiting, assistant handmaids, ladies of the handmaid's office, and so on used 'murasaki-itoge' (carts with purple threads).

sen.j: 半蔀車（はじとみぐるま）：檜を網代に組んで降り口の周りの部分に使い、覗き窓を開閉可能の半蔀にしたもの。
sen.e: Hajitomi-guruma: with wickerwork made from cypress attached to the area surrounding the exit, and with hajitomi (lattice shutter) viewing windows designed to open and close.
Hajitomi-guruma: with wickerwork made from cypress attached surrounding the exit, and with hajitomi (lattice shutter) viewing windows designed to open and close.
Hajitomi-guruma: With ajiro (wickerwork) made from cypress attached surrounding the exit, and with hajitomi (lattice shutter) viewing windows designed to open and close.

sen.j: 大臣や大将がプライベートに使用する。
sen.e: Daijin (ministers) or taisho (general) used it on informal occasions.
Daijin (ministers) or taisho (general) used it on informal occasions.
Daijin (ministers) or taisho (general) used it on informal occasions.

sen.j: 網代車（あじろぐるま）：半蔀車の網代を白く塗って地味にしたような車。
sen.e: Ajiro-guruma: an oxcart that looks like a hajitomi-guruma with the wickerwork painted white to make it look plain.
Ajiro-guruma: an oxcart that looks like a hajitomi-guruma with the wickerwork painted white to make it look plain.
Ajiro-guruma: An oxcart that looks like a hajitomi-guruma with the wickerwork painted white to make it look plain.

sen.j: 大臣･納言･大将の普段使い、侍従・中将・小将・四位･五位も使った。
sen.e: Ministers, counselors, and generals used it for everyday use, and it was also used by jiju (chamberlains), chujo (middle captains), shosho (major generals), and officials of the Fourth and Fifth ranks.
Ministers, counselors, and generals used it everyday, and it was also used by jiju (chamberlains), chujo (middle captains), shosho (major generals), and officials of the Fourth and Fifth ranks.

Ministers, counselors, and generals used it everyday, and it was also used by jiju (chamberlains), chujo (middle captains), shosho (major generals), and officials of Shii (the Fourth rank) and Goi (Fifth rank).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 八葉車（はちようのくるま）：網代を萌黄色（黄緑）に塗り、九曜星（八葉/大きな円の周りに小さな円を八つ書いたもの）の模様を書いたもの。
sen.e: Hachiyo no kuruma: an oxcart made with yellowish-green wickerwork and painted with kuyosei patterns (hachiyo: a big circle surrounded by eight small circles).
Hachiyo no kuruma: an oxcart made with yellowish-green wickerwork and painted with kuyosei patterns (hachiyo: a big circle surrounded by eight small circles).
Hachiyo no kuruma: An oxcart made with yellowish-green ajiro and painted with kuyosei patterns (also referred as hachiyo: a big circle surrounded by eight small circles).

sen.j: 二種類あり模様の大小で区別する。
sen.e: There were two kinds of this carat, and people distinguished them by the size of the patterns.
There were two types of this cart, and people distinguished them by the size of the patterns.
There were two types of this cart, and people distinguished them by the size of the patterns.

sen.j: 普段使い全般。
sen.e: For general everyday use.
For general everyday use.
For general everyday use.
